metadata.synopsis: If the Gith boy is unharmed, he can be persuaded to tell you about Orpheus, and subsequently to give you his copy of part of chapter 2.If he was stabbed (but not killed) by the player, the player can steal the chapter from him, or heal him and enter into the main conversation.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Gith Boy in the training room after either you save him from the teacher, or perform a non-fatal stab.

25.speaker: Youth Varrl
25.text: What have you done? You're no better than the sa'varsh.
25.context: NodeContext: scared but defiant - he just saw you kill his teacher/classmates.

29.speaker: Youth Varrl
29.text: Thank you, ra'stil. The sa'varsh would have left me there to die.

49.speaker: Youth Varrl
49.text: He's always telling us how we have to be ruthless, that death is the only mercy we deliver.

10.speaker: Youth Varrl
10.text: But you... You showed compassion, and kindness. You're just like - never mind.
10.context: NodeContext: Growing enthusiasm, then catches himself at the last moment

163.speaker: Youth Varrl
163.text: You - you've heard of him too?

166.speaker: Player
166.text: It wasn't a kindness. Vlaakith needs every sword against the ghaik, even yours.

4.speaker: Youth Varrl
4.text: Yes. Of course that's why you did it.

37.speaker: Youth Varrl
37.text: My sword will be ready. Vlaakith gha'g shkath zai!
37.context: NodeContext: Heart's not in it on the gith phrase

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I just keep believing I can be better. I hope you will do the same.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Next time I won't be there to intervene. Tread carefully.

70.speaker: Youth Varrl
70.text: I will. Though every step I take feels like the wrong one.

153.speaker: Youth Varrl
153.text: If I refuse to kill, but get myself killed in the process then I still failed to prevent a death.

125.speaker: Youth Varrl
125.text: Morality is complex, jhe'stil, but I will keep trying to understand it. To understand him.
125.context: NodeContext: the 'him' is a mystery to the player, but idolised by the boy (his hero)

101.speaker: Youth Varrl
101.text: You mean, you know who he is?

86.speaker: Youth Varrl
86.text: He's so strong, and - and wise. And he rides a comet. A comet!

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Without this? Show the boy the chapter you stole.
128.context: NodeContext: Hesitant, not sure he should say anything

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Wealth often clouds our moral judgement. I'd be happy to ease your burden...
20.context: NodeContext: Hesitant, not sure he should say anything

199.speaker: Player
199.text: Tell me, who teaches you to question yourself so?
199.context: NodeContext: Hesitant, not sure he should say anything

156.speaker: Youth Varrl
156.text: No one taught me. Not exactly.
156.context: NodeContext: Hesitant, not sure he should say anything

180.speaker: Youth Varrl
180.text: No one taught me. Not exactly.
180.context: NodeContext: Hesitant, not sure he should say anything

190.speaker: Youth Varrl
190.text: I've been reading about - about Orpheus. The true prince.

193.speaker: Youth Varrl
193.text: I know we're forbidden to talk about him. They say Vlaakith can hear you think his name.

126.speaker: Youth Varrl
126.text: I found his book... Part of it, anyway. I read it all the time. He's unbelievable.
126.context: NodeContext: Excited, sharing his secret passion

82.speaker: Player
82.text: By Vlaakith's blade, child - Orpheus is a traitor to our queen. Shut your mouth before the crèche elders hear your words.
82.context: NodeContext: Caught out, a bit embarassed

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.text: By Vlaakith's blade, child - Orpheus is a traitor to our queen. Shut your mouth before the crèche elders hear your words.
83.context: NodeContext: Caught out, a bit embarassed

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Where did you get this book?
32.context: NodeContext: Caught out, a bit embarassed

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Where did you get this book?
124.context: NodeContext: Caught out, a bit embarassed

41.speaker: Player
41.context: NodeContext: Caught out, a bit embarassed

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I agree, it's a real page-turner. Show him the book you stole.
8.context: NodeContext: Caught out, a bit embarassed

146.speaker: Player
146.text: 'Comet' you say? Like the one drawn on the portrait of Vlaakith?
146.context: NodeContext: Caught out, a bit embarassed

71.speaker: Player
71.text: His symbol was drawn onto Vlaakith's portrait. Was that you?
71.context: NodeContext: Caught out, a bit embarassed

87.speaker: Youth Varrl
87.context: NodeContext: Caught out, a bit embarassed

72.speaker: Youth Varrl
72.text: I wanted to know if there was anyone else here like me, someone who'd recognise it.
72.context: NodeContext: Growing a bit more enthusiastic, but holding back

192.speaker: Youth Varrl
192.text: I thought maybe I'd find a friend who'd want to talk about Orpheus. But nobody here cares about him.

204.speaker: Player
204.text: How did you get the book, if not from someone here?

165.speaker: Youth Varrl
165.text: A group of warriors came. Outsiders, on a mission for Vlaakith herself.

135.speaker: Youth Varrl
135.text: Sa'varsh Kethk made us clean their armour and... I found it, inside one of the breast plates.

198.speaker: Youth Varrl
198.text: I wish I knew who it belonged to - I have so many questions! Hopefully one day I'll find them.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Sounds like quite the book. Can I have it?

201.speaker: Player
201.text: That book belongs to me, vin'iisk. Give it back.

16.speaker: Youth Varrl
16.text: It's yours? Of course! That's why you were so ready to help me.

60.speaker: Youth Varrl
60.text: It's yours? Of course! That's why you were so ready to help me.

44.speaker: Youth Varrl
44.text: I've kept it safe the whole time. There's not even a splash of blood on it!
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boy hands over Orpheus Chapter 2 (unseen)

120.speaker: Youth Varrl
120.text: Where did you get it? What's your favourite line?
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player raises an eyebrow - they don't want to have this conversation.

0.speaker: Youth Varrl
0.text: You're right. This isn't the time. Sa'varsh Kethk might hear us.
0.context: InternalNodeContext: Reacting to the player's reluctance to have this conversation.

174.speaker: Youth Varrl
174.text: It was an honour to carry his words so close to my heart. Raz'erai'ka tavkim krash'ht.
174.context: NodeContext: As if saluting his hero

1.text: You're lying to me! Orpheus' words don't belong in the hands of someone so dishonest.
1.context: NodeContext: Sadness, turns to quiet outrage

178.speaker: Youth Varrl
178.text: You're lying to me! Orpheus' words don't belong in the hands of someone so dishonest.
178.context: NodeContext: Sadness, turns to quiet outrage

141.speaker: Youth Varrl
141.text: Besides, I - I don't have it with me. So I can't.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: It's mine. Those warriors borrowed it from me.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

202.speaker: Player
202.text: Hand it over. Or should I tell your captain to come and confiscate it?
202.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Hand it over. Or should I tell your sa'varsh to come and confiscate it?
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

150.speaker: Youth Varrl
150.text: No! Please don't tell the sa'varsh - he'll kill me! Just take it.
150.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

36.speaker: Youth Varrl
36.text: No! Please don't tell the sa'varsh - he'll kill me! Just take it.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

145.speaker: Youth Varrl
145.text: I'm sorry. I will not fail him again. Vlaakith gha'g shkath zai!

79.text: Well, if you tell him about the book, then... then I'll tell him I got it from you!

30.speaker: Youth Varrl
30.text: Well, if you tell him about the book, then... then I'll tell him I got it from you!

106.speaker: Youth Varrl
106.text: And do you know what happens to outsiders who cause trouble in the crèche?

206.speaker: Youth Varrl
206.text: Nobody does. But I've seen Kith'rak Therezzyn's wolves chewing on the leftovers. So keep quiet.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: You endanger yourself by carrying this around. It must be disposed of.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: Hand it over. Or should I tell your sa'varsh to come and confiscate it?

56.speaker: Player
56.text: You endanger yourself by carrying this around. It must be disposed of.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Have a look at my chapter. Perhaps you can find some answers in there.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy looks down at the story (unseen)

188.speaker: Youth Varrl
188.text: What is it? Is this... another part of the book?!
188.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy looks down at the story (unseen)

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Are you mad? This legend is a heresy to my Queen. Merely uttering his name is enough to tempt a violent fate.
152.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

170.speaker: Lae'zel
170.text: Are you mad? This legend is a heresy to my Queen. Merely uttering his name is enough to tempt a violent fate.
170.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

9.speaker: Player
9.text: These words, there's so much more to know about him. I can't believe it.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

58.speaker: Youth Varrl
58.text: These words, there's so much more to know about him. I can't believe it.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

52.speaker: Youth Varrl
52.text: Please, let me give you the fragment I have.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

184.speaker: Youth Varrl
184.text: Thank you, ra'stil. Raz'erai'ka tavkim krash'ht.

39.speaker: Youth Varrl
39.text: Please let me give you... Wait, where is it?
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Varrl scratches his head, confused that his book is missing.

53.speaker: Youth Varrl
53.text: One of the others must have stolen it. Shka'keths.

65.speaker: Youth Varrl
65.text: I'll say thank you then, as that's all I have. Raz'erai'ka tavkim krash'ht.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Have a look at my chapter. Perhaps you can find some answers in there.

173.speaker: Player
173.text: Have a look at one of my chapters. Perhaps you can find some answers in there.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: Show him the chapter you found.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Show him one of the chapters you found.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I might care, if you let me read your copy.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: You're right. I don't care about Orpheus. But the book is probably worth a good amount of coin. Show him the book you stole.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: So you're the k'chakhi who defaced our queen's portrait with this symbol.

59.speaker: Youth Varrl
59.text: I mean, I don't know what you're talking about.

169.speaker: Youth Varrl
169.text: Now please, I need to get these swords sharpened, or sa'varsh will sharpen them on me.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Do others here read these Orpheus stories?

26.speaker: Youth Varrl
26.text: I don't think so. No one I've met.

112.speaker: Youth Varrl
112.text: I drew his symbol where I thought someone might see it and recognise it.

100.speaker: Youth Varrl
100.text: But nobody did. I must have the only copy.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Yes, yes, very sad. Now about that payment you owe me...

167.speaker: Youth Varrl
167.text: I don't have anything to give you. I'm just a hatchling.

27.speaker: Youth Varrl
27.text: I thought you helped me because - because you were a good person. Like him.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I could talk about him, if you gave me your copy to read.

74.speaker: Youth Varrl
74.text: You want me to - No, it's mine! I have to keep it safe.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Hand it over. Or should I tell your captain to come and confiscate it?
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Hand it over. Or should I tell your sa'varsh to come and confiscate it?
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Hand it over. Or should I tell your sa'varsh to come and confiscate it?
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

137.speaker: Player
137.text: This story deserves to be told, and stir the hearts of our kin as it has yours.
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

186.text: You'd really tell others about him? That's so brave! Please, take it.
186.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

68.speaker: Youth Varrl
68.text: You'd really tell others about him? That's so brave! Please, take it.
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

66.speaker: Youth Varrl
66.text: You're a hero, just like Orpheus. Facing almost certain death to enlighten our people.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player raises an eyebrow - certain death?NodeContext: In awe

179.speaker: Player
179.text: I hope they write stories about you one day, ra'stil. I would tell them proudly.

148.speaker: Youth Varrl
148.text: I hope they write stories about you one day, ra'stil. I would tell them proudly.

191.speaker: Wyll
191.text: Well now - seems I'm in the presence of a gith legend in the making!

31.speaker: Youth Varrl
31.text: Really? I had no idea istiks cared about githyanki stories.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

154.speaker: Youth Varrl
154.text: Make sure you tell it right. Don't leave anything out!

88.speaker: Player
88.text: You endanger yourself by carrying this around. It must be disposed of.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

55.speaker: Youth Varrl
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

23.speaker: Youth Varrl
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

185.speaker: Youth Varrl
185.text: It's so stupid we can't read it. It's just a story, it's not even true.

42.speaker: Youth Varrl
42.text: I'll do my best to forget what it said. Thank you for taking it.

51.text: Nice try. You just want the book for yourself.

131.speaker: Youth Varrl
131.text: Nice try. You just want the book for yourself.

50.speaker: Youth Varrl
50.text: You're sneaky and... and horrible, like all the rest of them, aren't you? Leave me alone.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: You endanger yourself by carrying this around. It must be disposed of.
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

122.speaker: Player
122.text: There's a powerful song to be written from this tale, one our kin deserve to hear.
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

7.speaker: Youth Varrl
7.text: A song? That would be so cool! Here - take it.
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

168.speaker: Youth Varrl
168.text: A song? That would be so cool! Here - take it.
168.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

197.speaker: Youth Varrl
197.text: Maybe I could write my own song about him...
197.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player grimacesNodeContext: singing, not well, figuring it out as he goes...

11.speaker: Youth Varrl
11.text: Orpheus is so amazing. He saved us from the ghaiks' enslaving...
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player grimacesNodeContext: singing, not well, figuring it out as he goes...

75.text: I'm sorry. It's too dangerous. If you get caught, or they find out it was me -

46.speaker: Youth Varrl
46.text: I'm sorry. It's too dangerous. If you get caught, or they find out it was me -

200.speaker: Youth Varrl
200.text: I've already said too much. Please, don't mention his name again.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Are you sure about that? Show him the book you stole.

207.speaker: Youth Varrl
207.text: Is that... mine? You stole it from me?

81.speaker: Youth Varrl
81.text: I - I take it back! You're nothing like him at all!

94.speaker: Youth Varrl
94.text: Whatever. Take it. Read it. Maybe you'll learn how not to be a total shka'keth!

69.text: No... No. I'm sorry. I can't. It's too dangerous!

175.speaker: Youth Varrl
175.text: No... No. I'm sorry. I can't. It's too dangerous!

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Seek the name the boy is holding back.

203.speaker: Youth Varrl
203.text: Orpheus is so complex. Even the sa'varsh wouldn't understand him.

17.speaker: Youth Varrl
17.text: Orpheus is so complex. Even the sa'varsh wouldn't understand him.

33.text: What are you - are you trying to read my mind?

195.speaker: Youth Varrl
195.text: What are you - are you trying to read my mind?

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Compassion? Kindness? I did it for the gold. Now pay up.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Like Orpheus? Show the boy the chapter you stole.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Just like who? If there's a like-minded soul here, I'd love to meet them.

102.speaker: Youth Varrl
102.text: I speak of... of Orpheus. The true prince...

48.speaker: Youth Varrl
48.text: I speak of... of Orpheus. The true prince...

34.text: There's nobody here like you. Trust me.
34.context: NodeContext: Sad - this fact disappoints him

164.speaker: Youth Varrl
164.text: There's nobody here like you. Trust me.
164.context: NodeContext: Sad - this fact disappoints him

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Empathy is a tool in any good hunter's arsenal - no different to a notched arrow.
151.context: NodeContext: contemplating an adage spoken by an adult, slightly confused but inquisitively so

85.speaker: Youth Varrl
85.text: That's... wise. I think. You sound just like him. Prince Orpheus.
85.context: NodeContext: contemplating an adage spoken by an adult, slightly confused but inquisitively so

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Your teacher has forgotten what truly makes a warrior.
3.context: NodeContext: he's a tad off guard - litmus testing player to see if they are trustworthy

139.speaker: Youth Varrl
139.text: You... You think so? What... what does it mean to be a warrior, then?
139.context: NodeContext: he's a tad off guard - litmus testing player to see if they are trustworthy

162.speaker: Player
162.text: A capacity for mercy is what separates us from feral beasts.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Warriors make war. We fight for something, not just to kill.

115.speaker: Youth Varrl
115.text: Yes, you're right... There's more to it than just killing. There has to be.

19.speaker: Youth Varrl
19.text: At least, that's what Prince Orpheus says.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Discipline - a quality your teacher obviously failed to instil.

172.speaker: Youth Varrl
172.text: Oh. Okay. Fine. I thought you might have been different. More like him.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Seek the name the boy refuses to reveal.
105.context: NodeContext: Scared, this name is forbidden on pain of death

196.text: Don't mention Orpheus. Don't mention Orpheus...
196.context: NodeContext: Scared, this name is forbidden on pain of death

14.speaker: Youth Varrl
14.text: Don't mention Orpheus. Don't mention Orpheus...
14.context: NodeContext: Scared, this name is forbidden on pain of death

92.speaker: Youth Varrl
92.text: Wait! What if the sa'varsh can read my mind?!

12.speaker: Youth Varrl
12.text: Don't think about Orpheus. Don't think about Orpheus...
12.context: NodeContext: Scared, this name is forbidden on pain of death

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *The boy is unconscious, the wound on his chest slowly bleeding him dry...*

123.speaker: Youth Varrl
123.text: Stop distracting me - I'm in enough trouble as it is!

177.speaker: Youth Varrl
177.text: I can't say any more, the sa'varsh might hear. Now please, let me finish my work!

181.speaker: Youth Varrl
181.text: That was amazing. I've never seen someone talk the sa'varsh down from a rage like that.
